NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector

NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector Interface Reference

An interface of a connector.

Definition: A connector is a collection of synapses connecting neurons from one layer to another layer. More...

Detailed Description

An interface of a connector.

Definition: A connector is a collection of synapses connecting neurons from one layer to another layer.

Member Function Documentation

void NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector.Connect ( IConnector  connector  ) 

Parameters:
connector The connector being connected.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Connectors.Connector.

void NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector.Connect (  ) 

Connects the connector.

A connector is said to be connected if: 1. it is aware of its source layer (and vice versa), 2. it is aware of its target layer (and vice versa), and 3. its synapses are connected.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Connectors.Connector.

void NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector.Disconnect ( IConnector  connector  ) 

Parameters:
connector The connector to be disconnected.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Connectors.Connector.

void NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector.Disconnect (  ) 

Disconnects the connector.

A connector is said to be disconnected if: 1. its source layer is not aware of it (and vice versa), 2. its target layer is not aware of it (and vice versa), and 3. its synapses are disconnected.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Connectors.Connector.

void NeuralNetwork.Connectors.IConnector.Initialize (  ) 

Initializes the connector.

Implemented in NeuralNetwork.Connectors.Connector.
